snippet: After Mr. Trump posted a video mocking Ben Carson as a liar, the more pressing question seemed to concern whether Mr. Trump will be able to attract a majority of Republican primary voters.
abstract: Some Republicans believe Donald J Trump's mounting attacks on rival Ben Carson signal beginning of end of Trump's own presidential bid; billionaire businessman has shown little ability to move beyond personality-driven attraction to argue his fitness for job, while harsh invective against Carson may alienate many.

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and PATRICK HEALY
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Trip Gabriel, Jonathan Martin, Alan Rappeport and Matt Flegenheimer.

lead_paragraph: After Mr. Trump posted a video mocking Ben Carson as a liar, the more pressing question seemed to concern whether Mr. Trump will be able to attract a majority of Republican primary voters.

headline.main: Some See Attacks by Donald Trump as Start of His Downfall
headline.print_headline: Some See Trump Attacks as Start of His Downfall
